description:
Solid place to go to after work on a weeknight. My bud and I were exhausted after working a long day. We decided to snag a brew and wind down our day. He said that he's been here before and it is a good spot to hangout. I concur. This place is on the older side, it is a neighborhood bar and I like the older feel. 

Upon walking in this place is divey; great vibe and a place I would want to become a regular, if I lived in the area. People are just watching TV, different sports are playing. There is only one bartender but she is not overwhelmed, there is enough people in the bar but not crowded. There are seats that go around the bar (as usual) and there are seats there are tables that fit four people where you can sit on your own. 

The brews on tap are all we drank. I had the death and taxes and my bud had the Gose sour. Solid brews that aren't your normal choices. I always appreciate places trying different styles of beers that aren't your standard beers on tap. As far as drink, I have no idea of their mixology. The food pretty limited. There isn't a menu for it, rather its stricly bar snacks. You can purchase you own chips, but there is a popcorn stand that people can get complimentary. Just ask the bartender for a bowl and you can grab your own as many times as you want. There are condiments to add to it - more cheese, garilic and spice to your own liking.

In the back there is one pool table. Old school billards where you have to ask the bartender for change. My only qualm is that there was a hair in my second beer, it happens. Otherwise this place is a solid choice I would go to on a regular.
author: Mark G.

description: This is a classic and great go-to dive bar. Good priced drinks, darts and open until 2am which is very convenient as we were trying to find a casual bar at 1am. They also have a good selection of beers which was chill.
author: Kourtney B.

description: Location is great! RIght next to a lot of yummy 9th and Irving restaurants. The bar itself is pretty cool. Very quaint and the staff is nice!
author: James D.

description:
Brett
Emily
Scott
and the doorman (Alex) I think...please forgive me.  They are a solid kick ass bar crew.  I love them all.....I love that shandy beer has a blood orange/grapefruit blend .
author: Jennifer C.

description: Tbh I had a good time I brought my own flask because I'm broke and they provided me a chaser without any questions. Would come back anytime.
author: Ailani H.

description: Great neighborhood bar. I've been coming here for years. Brett pours a mean Jack and Ginger. They have a juke box, a pool table, and free popcorn. I recommend stopping in for a drink if you're in the area. Don't expect a fancy atmosphere with warm towels in the bathroom but you will get great bartenders, stiff drinks, and no BS. Parking is tough but don't drive, because you might leave drunk!
author: Jill H.

description: A bit rough around the edges but a lovely local spot. Bartenders are friendly and let you order in pizza if you ask nicely.
author: Alex I.

description: Cheap drinks, interesting patrons, and good bartenders... what more can I say? Oh, they also have free popcorn!
author: Ken P.

description: Very fun place. Locals kind of place. Watched 7th game of World Series tonight (Go Cubs!) and not too crowded. Just full enough to make atmosphere fun. Lots of beers on draft. No food other than chips, peanuts and pop corn. But last time I was here I was encouraged to order food delivered here. That was great. Kaitlyn the bartender makes up for any misgivings you might have for no food. Besides. It's a bar folks.
author: JW Z.

description: I came here with some friends to watch the Oregon Ducks game based on the name. Yes, it was dive-y. But, the game was on, the beers were cold and the bartender had character. I would return! My favorites were the Baby Daddy and the Tricerahops. They also had a pool table and jukebox if you're into that kind of thing. Go Ducks! :)
author: Jana B.

description:
I have always had an amazing time here.
 Tonight the mood was ruined by a short asian  bouncer with a beard/ in a red shirt and a piercing. When we arrived he was smoking a cigarette under the doorway, and performing a drunken interpretation of a ska dance about the street and bar. We saw no one there and proceeded to enter and then he sprinted up to us when we were half way in. 

At about 1:40  as me and my friends  were in the middle of playing pool, he passively aggressively put the pool sticks away then came up to us , and asked if we were on acid. We politely responded by saying no and asked him to relax. He responded by saying we had 15 minutes to get out before he put a bruise on our faces. We realize he had a long night and the bar was closing, but there is a nicer way of saying " we are closing soon you will have to leave" than threatening your customers.

Asked him his name he said Derrick and then some other customers called him Alex.
author: Merry T.

description:
Hey. Just arrived in the sunset area. My life was going great, meeting people, getting to know the locals.. Until it was utterly ruined by the depressing fact that i could not take a simple shot with the Monday Night bartender.

This is unacceptable.

It is a god given right, at least in this great country called Amurica, to take a shot with fellow Amuricans.

Management. Please revise your standards.

Thank you
author: Chris H.

description:
If you want free popcorn? Sure. 
If you want to watch the Warriors game in silence while the jukebox plays? Sure.
Interesting mix of people!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Essentially the anchor of the neighborhood.  Great folks on both sides of the bar, awesome beer selection, and a fun and laid back atmosphere.  I live a couple of blocks away and while there are several other bars in the neighborhood, this is always my choice when I want a few drinks in the neighborhood.  Also, you can order food next door at Howard's and they'll bring it over for you if you'd like.

Oh, and a little historical trivia: This location has been a bar since at least 1945.  Originally Ed & Bert's Tavern, then The 9th Inning in 1955 (which you can still see the sign from if you walk to the back of the bar, face the front, and look up), and then finally The Mucky Duck in 1996.
author: Joshua W.

description: Always a fun interesting crowd.  Great for ppl watching, playing pool and grabbing a beer.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
I came here on a Friday night with a couple of friends.

Atmosphere is great for hanging out and watching the game. The Giants game was on and this was before they made it to the World Series, so the excitement was in the air!

So a few things I noticed about this place:
- They carded all of us when we entered.
- The clock on the wall is slightly fast.
- If you have a big party, the place is more rectangular than wider but there's enough room for everyone.
- Great atmosphere.
author: Margaret L.

description: Often affectionately called The Mallard, Mucky F***, or The Dirty Bird, this establishment embodies all of the above with its rowdy crowds and free-for-all juke box.  It's not the cheapest place to get a drink in the Inner Sunset, but you pay extra for the attractive bartenders and the option of free popcorn.  I tend to find myself drinking more when I frequent this bar, perhaps to make the unavoidable small talk with older men more palatable. Sundays are good during football season here since they have quite a few televisions to show multiple games simultaneously if you're into that.  You can also order food next door at Howard's to be delivered to the Duck and eat it there, which is always nice if you don't want to leave the bar.
author: Amber D.

description: Emily makes a mean sex on the beach, has a sweet disposition and zero "San Francisco" attitude. She also rocks good jams!
author: Paula I.

description: This place is a part of our track team's weekly post-workout routine.  It's grungy and has no food, but you can bring in any food from around 9th and Irving.  The place next door actually has actually brought food in on a plate.  Red is an awesome bartender and always sorts the garbage from your meal to compost/recycling/trash.
author: Ryan I.

description: If you aren't a drunk that just wants to sit and drink don't come here. They don't appreciate enthusiasm.  Pool table sucks, owner is sexist. I try and stay away.
author: Heather H.

description:
I like this pub. Especially the sassy bartender who says "martinis are like tits, you have to have two." I like that the bartenders are always friendly, and that they make a mean martini. :)

(But seriously, though, if your bartender - *not* the above-mentioned sassy one - has a stinking cold, please make her stay at home. She was coughing all over the place, and, I suspect, was the reason I had to call in sick to my own job.)
author: Mi M.

description:
It had been a while since I'd been in this joint. We came here before our venture to San Tung and had a bit of fun. Bella was being her boisterous and fun-loving self and we made some friends in there as a result. Bartender was a bit on the slower side but I guess it didn't matter too much at the time.

Just some regular folks in a regular neighborhood bar and since we made friends there I'll kick down another star.
author: Art O.

description:
I gotta say that there is something quite comforting and reassuring about Mucky Duck. There's no pretension here. Their bartenders are low-key, quick, and just nice people. The crowd is an interesting mixture of regulars and people who look like they just wandered in. But there is always something familiar about this place.

It's the kind of place that you can trudge on down to in your pajamas and no one will care. It's the kind of place that you can sit at the bar in tears and some kind soul will drunkenly try to comfort you (I wasn't the one crying - but I did witness this exchange). With a decent juke-box and a solid bar table, and free popcorn with gourmet toppings - you just gotta respect a place that just does their thing - day in - day out.  Literally.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
How could you not like a bar called Mucky Duck? That name alone deserves a star.

I've spent a lot of time in the Sunset, but never really noticed this place until my coworker wanted to grab a drink after work on St. Patty's day. They had a lot of different beers on tap for around $4-5/pint. Pretty typical dive bar, but the bartenders and crowd were friendly and fun. I liked the layout of the place even though it's not very big. There are a few tables on the left side against the wall and across from the bar and a pool table in the back as well. The only thing I didn't like about this bar is the fact that it's pretty much cash only because the limit for credit cards is $20. My coworker and I didn't have cash so we ended up starting a tab and then buying chips and nuts just to spend the whole amount because we weren't really looking to get wasted at that time of day.
author: Stephanie G.

description: Convenient location and always has plenty of sports playing, but holy moly the prices here are way too high. $4.50 for a PBR? $7 for a Stella? You gotta be kidding.
author: Brandon M.

description: Mike, Brett, Scott, Carly, Josh and the rest of the Muckey Duck team are simply the best around town. I always enjoy a nice brew (Moose Droole is great!) and can relax in good company. Great dive and genuine service, can't go wrong.
author: Omar C.

description:
Every time I come here the bartenders are so super nice. I also found out that Howard's, the next door diner, will serve you some grubbing food and walk it to you here. I haven't eaten at Howard's yet, but you can bet I will try it out soon.

They have a decent wine list in addition to their top shelf spirits including Concannon-a nice offshoot from Livermore with a full bodied, sweet Cabernet. 

Great service all around, right down to the phone charging station. You can really tell when an establishment is centered on their guests.
author: Jessica C.

description: Very well lit and very impressive beer selection.  Plenty of room for groups and a decent pool table. Overall good place. But I'm hungry. So there's that; no food.
author: Steven T.

description:
My favorite bar in the sunset so far. Mike the bartender is great. Definitely cares and values his customers! Definitely something I love! Came on a Thursday and it was chill, laid back, and had some interesting people. 

They don't have my favorite blue moon there but I found something better! Tangerine wheat! So goooood!!!

Definitely my neighborhood bar!
author: Michelle N.

description:
My favorite bar in the city so far!! Perfect to hang around and watch some games while meeting awesome people :) 
Bartenders are kind and helpful too. 
Ok guys, let me enjoy my drinks now !
author: Mehdi A.

description:
Mucky Duck has a very divey and welcoming atmosphere, and I found that this was one of my favorite bars on a recent vacation to San Francisco.

We walked in around 5pm on a Sunday evening after spending many hours walking around Golden Gate Park. We grabbed a table near the bar and checked out the selection before heading over to the bartender to order. They had a decent selection of local/regional draft beers, so we decided to stay and have a few before dinner.

The bartender was friendly and prompt with our orders, and the bar seemed pretty lively for a Sunday evening. I could tell there were a fair amount of regulars in this bar, as well as some random stragglers of tourists venturing into the bar for a drink.
author: Megan K.

description: $8 pints of Guinness - enough said.    Head around the corner to Blackthorn for $5 pints.
author: D S.

description: Sunsets a bit of a commute for me but when I'm there I'm there for a couple days so I need to find a good watering hole to have a good time at! I knew I was coming into the city so on my commute I checked Voo (https://tryvoo.com) and saw the $1 off Drafts; $5 Wells that was being offered at Mucky Duck so I thought why not? When I showed up I was expecting more of a lively crowd but it was pretty quiet. maybe because it was a Tuesday night? Not sure but either way, I like the place.
author: Peter B.

description: Friendly staff, good prices, and an awesome lil' window booth for people watching. They also know how to keep the volume level. I love it!
author: Cecilia A.

description:
Great dive in the Sunset.

Full of frat-ish bros

Awesome sassy bartenders who keep it real

They often have free popcorn from their old timey machine in the back

They close late and show sports games

They have a real loud jukebox and pool table.

Clean bathrooms.
author: Meg M.

description: Good ole dive bar, cool bartenders.
author: Sarah S.

description:
When one slows down from this modern life of toil long enough to brave the world of social inebriation among both friends & the unknown mysterious miscreants of this fine city they may find their intentions fall under the purview of our quaint quarterage; The Mucky Duck. Here, sitting betwixt the plebeian ale sippers & bourgeois scotch snobs, I find myself slipping into gaiety as, guzzling micro-brewed craft brews, a veritable pot of gold is place here, directly before me. O' frosted vessel of precious pyrite, however ubiquitous your origin, your purpose is clearer than the five times distilled potato vodka served up with a twist which occupies the three by three square of bar which I currently patron. You're kernels, both the popped & those poor lost souls which were never brought to fruition (it's ok, I'm pro-choice), had naught a chance of pulling the wool over my eyes. You have brought ghosts! Apparitions of yesteryear to haunt my very core. 

I didn't even need to ask the altruistic man tending bar which brand of corn he was popping for it held residence in the forefront of my memory. Jolly Time, All in One. The very same seeds of mirth I sowed whilst visiting my uncles cottage in the early autumns of my youth. Jolly Times was there for my first adventure into the woods. Jolly Times was there when Tommy fell in the lake. Jolly Times was there when I plucked Tommy from icy hell & an arctic obituary. And Jolly Times was there as Helen, angel, savior, maiden of salvation, wrapped our frigid frost bitten bodies in hand woven woolen blankets. There, side by side with my comatose companion in our complacent cocoon, Helens eyes tore at my very existence. At the funeral, as Tommy's nubile corpse lowered into an eternity of unknown darkness & a massive abyss of emptiness, I passed a handful of Jiffy Pop™ to Helen. Together we sunk into an ecstasy of melted butter & melancholy. 

This robust aroma activates a sixth sense, awakening long forgotten feelings & memories. Jiffy Pop, you beautiful bastard. Such joy. Such love. Such... 

To try to explain the torrential emotions that are brought to the surface of my once guarded heart by Jiffy Pop's delicate balance of flavors would be a fools errand. One might as soon explain the beauty of the sea, or the merriment found in laughter. Can you describe the twinkle in a child's eye? No. And it is all the better as such. 

O Nepenthe, wipe clean the slate of my mind. Leave not a trace of this wretched history I have made. Sweet Helen, forgive my impotence. I can not bare this burden, this infernal pox. Twas such sweet times spent with you my love. Basking in the twin glow of the sun & the jumbo bag of Jiffy Pop™ All in One™ popping corn as we watch the sun set over our ecclesiastic history. I would not have forsaken a single moment spent with you, my love. Sucks that Tommy died though. 

Also, The Duck takes credit cards. 
7 out of 9: would try again.
author: Langdon A.

description:
We were on a mission to eat something and watch the Olympics. Sadly, there was no kitchen but a super friendly guy explained to us that we could get food from next door. The bartender fished out some menus for us and I happily trotted over to place my order while my gal pal got the drinks.

If I didn't have errands to run, I'm pretty sure we could have stayed there until closing. Our food came, my pal and I chatted about life, the Olympics, and when the five o'clock news came on and the channel searches turned up nothing else, I was comforted by some friendly strangers. I love places with friendly strangers.

I'm done with my errands now, so I'm looking forward to coming back, watching more Olympics, and introducing myself so these friendly people aren't strangers anymore.

Oh! And they have a popcorn machine!
author: Loli L.

description:
Great neighborhood bar and even greater bartenders.  What can I say?  If you order call in any bar in this city it is going to cost you so stop complaining about at $10 Hendricks.  It would cost the same in the TL!
Katie, Red Mike, Lars, Kristy and staff are the greatest.  This is how great they are.  They will be holding a fundraiser for Avon Walk for Breast Cancer on September 11, 5-9, with free appetizers and raffle to raise money,  and donating their tips to the cause!  That shows you how involved in community they are.  Jason, the owner, is totally involved with the neighborhood and with people in general.
See you there.
author: Catania G.

description:
Every single time I have been here I have memory of walking in, but not out. That's a sign of a good time.

Oh, and they have pop-corn! Thanks and looking forward to more drunken nights.
author: Alexia R.

description: Yarnold Palmer! You are the "O" to my face!! I dream of you and want you every day of my life! You make the world  a better place! Gyesss it's very jummyyy!!!
author: Jocelyn G.

description: Fun to hang out during the day, didn't feel like I would be into it at night. Bloody Marys are bomb and bartenders are nice!
author: Rachel L.

description: I had deleted his app due to frustration with yelp through my mobile app. So to download it and write a review there would need to be a good reason. If you have been to Mucky Duck and Katie(sp) was yr bartender, then that's reason enough. She is personable, friendly, and on top of things. All good qualities for a bartender. Nice mellow place, kick back atmosphere but I bet it would tend to get busy during peak hours.
author: Shannon M.

description:
Had a decent time here for about an hour and then a douche bag bouncer at the end of the night ruined the feel good time.  

With multiple patrons left on July 23rd 2011 near closing time this creep started getting verbally abusive when it was completely unwarranted.  I mean really we are going to "feel the pain" because we are on his time?  Only made me want to kick that punk ass bitch in the teeth, not conducive to peacefully getting people out.  

A polite you have to go would have sufficed.   I mean if he was kidding it might have been funny.  I wish i had got the creeps name.  He wasn't ridiculously abusive, but enough to piss several of us off (including the owner of a much better local bar).    

Anytime you have been polite and start getting treated like a piece of shit it ruins whatever goodwill you had towards a place.  The bartenders were good, but the bouncer would make me either kick his ass or go 
somewhere else.  

Part of what made it more frustrating is when a couple of us commented on what  a creep this guy was being we got blown off.    The customer is never right here and you can expect to be treated like crap.  At least that was the message i got last time i was there.

Otherwise a great dive bar.   : )
author: Brian J.

description: Small dive bar in my neck of the woods! Always a good time, good tunes, good beers on tap. Tricerahops and the only bar in SF I have seen Ninkasi Vanilla Oatis on tap! Great place to catch a quick drink before you jump on the N Judah to go downtown! Do it!
author: Nick L.

description:
A group of four of us were here watching the SF vs. I-forgot-who football game.  This was in December or January.  Before the Superbowl.  But SF won.  So it was great.  It was the Saints.  That's right.  I remember now because the BF and I picked up some take-out from a BBQ place in the Filmore area and some fried chicken and biscuits from a different restaurant around the corner.  It was sunday funday.  People were out in their fancy clothes to go to brunch.  But we were out for football.

We sat at one of the bar tables.  There were several TVs playing the game.  The whole place was wicked crowded.  As men walked through the crowd, they took the opportunity to grope some backs, shoulder blades, hips, stomachs.  Did it matter if the body part belonged to a girl, boy, or goat?  Not that day.

One young man wearing a red plaid shirt was incredibly intoxicated.  He stood up on the bar at the end of the game.  And groped some more girls.  I saw some interesting tattoos on this one girl with long, stringy black hair.  Was it a poem?  Some kind of really really long poem written on her back.  Reminded me a little bit of Pam on the TV cartoon Archer.  Pam had a scary weird tattoo on her back too.

They make a mean Virgin Mary here.  It was spicy, salty, lime-filled and glorious.  Vitamin C keeps the scurvy away.
author: Christina C.

description:
Nice mellow bar.  Serves popcorn and standard drinks.  Low key and unpretentious like the Sunset.  

A bunch of us were having a really nice pool game here until some guy showed up and wouldn't get off the table.  Granted he was winning every game, but it's not the best way to endear yourself to people when you're "new in town," dude.  Not really the bar's fault, though.
author: Mark W.

description:
Easily the tastiest popcorn in the entire universe, hands down. Bartenders are generally pretty nice, and the prices arent bad at all.

Did I mention the popcorn?
author: Nelson S.

description:
Pretty much the worst bar in San Francisco..

a cheapskate owner, unfriendly staff, small glasses filled to capacity with ice, minimal booze, and a suspicious ambiance (ie, if you aren't a regular, you ain't wanted around these parts)

skip it!!  take your cash around the corner to the awesome Blackthorn
author: Ted K.

description: I've been going here since before it was the Mucky Duck. It has never been great, but it is better than it used to be.
author: Patrick S.

description: Great dive bar near the park- just happened to stroll into this place- the bartender was extremely nice and ended up meeting some locals and within  an hour we were all taking shots and high fiving- good times and good people
author: Alejandro G.

description:
Sorry, Mucky Duck...had I known of your reputation before hand, we may have avoided this entirely.

While your drinks may be cheap, and your atmosphere quite chill, we won't be seeing each other anymore.  You're perfect for smokers, allowing your guests to light up inside, but it's a deal breaker for me.  I don't have a problem with the folks who come here to take advantage of the opportunity, but I'm not exactly itching to take the smell of cigarettes home with me as a souvenir either.  With that in mind, there's really no reason for me to come back to you when I can just as easily stop off at Yancy's around the corner.

Although it may not make you feel any better, it's better that we end this sooner rather than later.  I'd say it's me and not you...but that just wouldn't be the truth.  Sorry.
author: Mike L.

description: With a sincere smile and a quick wit, Misses Katie aka " Lady ace fo twenty-fo" holds no punches.  She has the knowledge of a mixologist...without the arrogance. Can you dig it?! Just a head's up...there's a not-so-secret button that allows her to stymie your wack ass jukebox selection. She uses this with almost clairvoyant accuracy.  For that, the music (g)ods are eternally thankful. Whisper the secret words "Icky Thicky" and a treasure chest of pearly whites will magically appear...and mayyybe a shot.  She's gonna get pissed at me for that last bit =)
author: Walter J.

description: Solid dive in the upper Haight. Drinks are reasonably priced and the staff is quick to serve. Not too crowded on a Friday evening is always nice to find. I'll be sure to visit again.
author: Pete F.

description:
I recently found myself across the country, and exploring San Francisco. Since I've spent my entire life either in the Midwest or on the East coast, I had no idea what to expect.

The bartender was nice-- engaging in some decent conversation and helping my friend and I find the right bus to get back to Sausalito. The crowd was a bit rough, with one guy getting kicked out of the bar. Although, I suppose I'd rather have him kicked out than causing a ruckus inside! They have lady's night specials, every night. My drink was only 4 dollars! Overall, it was a great experience and definitely something worth checking out if you're into a more relaxed setting. 

But! I am giving it only 4 stars, because I believe there's always room for improvement-- and because I didn't get any of this alleged free popcorn.
author: Margo M.

description:
My friends and I were waiting for a table at crawstation across the street and made our way over here for a snake bite.   

They had apple cider for the snake bite and it was something different I have not tried.  I was def a happy camper.  

A dive bar feel and had a pool table in the back. Wasn't packed since it was dinner hours, not sure how I would like it if the place was packed.  

Will def come back for a beer while I wait for my dinner table again.
author: Chanel L.

description: Katie is the best. Not only is she fun to hang out with, she makes the best Bloody Mary in the city. Hands down the best way to spend your afternoon!
author: Bailey B.

description:
One of the great pubs nearby my house. This one has a distinct neighborhood feel and not many UCSF students go to this one so it doesn't feel collegiate. What is great is that this place is located in a great commercial area in the Inner Sunset so if you don't particularly like this place, you can walk across the street or down the block and find another one. I'm sure you'll like this place though. It's easy to get the bartender's attention (though, once you get your first drink at the bar, you should address him by his name, and not as "hey"). 

This place is a great place to watch baseball as the Giants games always attract the hardcore baseball fans no matter what the team.
author: Rylan C.

description: One of my favorite little finds in the Inner Sunset. Katie and Brett are my favorite bartenders. Great brews on tap, and one of the best "dirty Belvederes (martini)" I've had.
author: Launie D.

description:
This bar just went up, like, a notch.

What happened on my walk home tonight? Oh, just some dude getting arrested on the sidewalk. So the bar is classy enough to kick someone out? Boss. But then again, it's the kind of bar that needs to kick d-bags out every once in a while. I guess i take back that extra star i was going to give them.

Thanks for the entertainment, Mucky Duck, but still not sure i'll be back more often.
author: Phuong M.

description: All I have to say is this is our bar. This is the place I go after work, in my free time, and anytime I want to play pool. It's your classic dive without the creepy old men trying to hit on you. I feel comfortable here and always end up staying until last call.
author: Lauren K.

description:
Been coming here on and off for years.  No relation to the Mucky Duck in Monterey, but I always think of the other whenever I'm at either.

Popped in here yesterday (late Saturday) afternoon and wow, I don't know who picked those selections, but they had some jammin' rockin' selections playing on the jukebox.  The bartender, Lisa, was super sweet and cool and I was surprised to hear that she is the daughter of a bartender at one of my favorite bards in North Beach.

Struck up a great conversation about cars with a patron who is a mechanic and a certified car nut and also shot some great pool in the back as well.  Great little area back there to shoot pool and the table was pretty good although the bumpers could have used some work.  Left here to go to a lesser bar in the outer avenues afterwards and truly regretted it when I got there.  So lame, but I know the owner and regulars there, so I won't name it here.

Cars, pool, and alcohol!  The Mucky Duck is a great local bar...not sure why I haven't come here more often in the past.
author: Roy N.

description: At 2pm when you decide that it's 5pm somewhere in the world, Mucky Duck is a good place to be. It's your no frills neighborhood sports bar where the bartender eggs you on while you're drinking an Irish car bomb and takes the whole thing away from you to save you embarrassment when the thing curds up cuz you drank it too slow. They have awesome happy hour specials, take credit cards with a reasonable minimum, serve snacks, so when you're on the corner on 9th and Irving, give this place a shot!
author: Christine B.

description: Fun crowd dive bar. Small space. Pool table. Full liquor. 20 taps. Average prices. Mediocre specials.
author: Brian L.

description: The Mucky Duck has a great selection of beers, including some I had never heard of.  The happy hour and sunday specials are very reasonable, 2 beers like prohibition for 8 bucks!
author: Dante and Alleliah G.

description:
Good sports bar, nice beer selection on tap. The best part is bartender Kimberly.
Cash only, but ATM inside and Bank of America across the street.
author: Anelya S.

description:
Not the greatest place, except for this one drink called the eye dropper.
It makes you do very crazy things (so don't bring any friends, you'll regret it the next morning).  Dive-bar-esque, except for the prices: affordable, but for San Francisco. 
PS: for your own safety, duck when you come in (seriously, not a pun)  the dart board is right by the entrance and sometime the players are going for distance.
author: Mike V.

description:
Must...resist...pun...ok, I think I'm over it.

This is certainly the most generic dive bar I've been to in SF so far.  Even the Shannon Arms has the somewhat intimidating all-irish clientele.  But inside the Mucky Duck, I could've been anywhere in America, and probably one of the less cool parts.  I dunno, maybe I'm too hipster, but I like even my dive bars to have a little wink-wink to them

PS--they used to have one of the best jukeboxes in the city, but it broke and they replaced it with one of those internet I'll-play-whichever-song-that-I-get-the-most-money-for-no-matter-how-awful-while-shafting-everyone-else whore-boxes.
author: Wes M.

description: I had been curious about this neighborhood dive for a long time and finally decided to check it out for a much needed after-work beer.  For a dive bar the on tap beer selection is quite impressive - bonus star for having two different IPAs on tap!
author: Bumble B.

description:
Neighborhood bar. Talk. Enjoy. 

You will be talked to by the locals that are seemingly comfortably unhinged.

I think I am developing a problem with the bar and staff, rather than a problem with the boooze.  Frankly, they are so awesome, welcoming, friendly, and cute as the dickens.

I am like a chocoholic, but for booze.  In this bar. Likely tomorrow.  See you.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description:
You can find me here on weeknights blowing off some steam.  Its my usual watering hole because i dont have to worry about getting scammed on when all im trying to do is unwind and enjoy my drinks in peace.  Lots of regulars in here, which adds to its appeal.  The bartenders are super friendly and awesome and they usually have good tunes playing on the juke.  The crowd is for the most part pretty mellow, although i went for the first time on a weekend, and it was a little more busy than i normally like.  I'll stick to my usual days.

Im pretty chill and like a laid back bar to drink in.  I never worry about getting dolled up to go to the duck so this particular night it felt beyond weird sitting in there drinking my whisky with a dress on.  Never.  Again.
author: Juv C.

description: I got invited to come out by a friend and met his friends here. It seemed like a nice dive bar that would be cool to come out with a few friends and just chat. It really reminds me of the bar in How I met your Mother.
author: Eric M.

description: Katie makes the best bloody Mary's! She's awesome company when we come in and drink at inappropriate times. Fun place!
author: Katie R.

description: Watched the NFC Championship here yesterday.  The space is a typical sports/dive bar.  They have 2 single stall restrooms, plenty of bar seating, and a pool table.  The bartenders were very good, only two girls supported the madhouse yesterday and did a fab job.  I'll definitely go back when I'm in the area, and would even consider it an alternative to the always crowded Yancys.
author: Jennifer T.

description: Visited the Mucky Duck for the first time last night. It was a great experience. There was a table of guys that looked like they were having a BROmance, a few scattered couples and some singletons like me. There was plenty of room at the bar. I tried the Tangerine brew for the first time. LOVED IT!!!! The bartender was very friendly and quick. I will definitely visit this place again.
author: Chantel S.

description: Went to the Mucky Duck after eating breakfast at Art's on St. Patricks morning. It's a dive/sport/locals kinda place, and I'm down with that.. I immediately felt the locals vibe as soon as sat down. Everyone was feelin pretty good even though it was before noon since it was St. Pats. Everyone seemed to know each other, and there was hella food being brought in as people arrived. Someone came up to our table and invited us to eat (since it was obvious we didn't live in the hood), and made sure we felt welcome. They have a pool table and the game on various TV's. Probably a fun place to watch Giants games. If we weren't driving, we would have stayed for more than a drink. Mucky Duck.....I will see you again for sure and next time I'm gettin drunk!
author: Mel Z.

description: A nice, local, affordable bar. That's it.
author: Andrew K.

description: The bartenders here are excellent, but it's definitely always a shitshow of drunkards regardless of whether it's a weekend or weekday.  I don't think it would be a good place to bring a date or your parents.  I definitely think it is a great place for people who like heavily boozing.  People who come here are chatty, so if you are shy, expect for random slurring people to talk to you.
author: Julia D.

description:
I really wish this could be in my hood.  I went there for HH last week and greatly enjoyed myself.  The service was pleasant, drinks strong, bathroom clean, had liar's dice and best part, we were able to bring in food from Arizmendis!  

One of the biggest perks is the free popcorn plus seasonings.  They have a variety of salts (ie cheese, garlic, etc..) so you can makes yours special. 

There's juke box so that's always a great conversation starter or argument.  Bummer no Beatles though :(.
author: Laura H.

description: I am brand new to San Francisco (I moved in 2 days ago) and the Mucky Duck was the perfect place to have my first SF pint. Bartender was polite and not invasive and the clientele was a perfect mix of chatty regulars and friends having a mellow drink. I hope to someday get my name on the list of regulars!
author: Michelle S.

description:
I've worked in the neighborhood for over a year and a half at this point, and only recently began to visit the Mucky Duck. I think what kept me away was the "sports bar" thing, and the fact that I don't want to run into my clients while drinking excessively. I don't know what happened, but one night I ended up in here with a co-worker (probably to wait for the bus in a more enjoyable fashion that shivering on the corner), and it's sort of been our post work boozing spot ever since.

Things I like: 
Popcorn, which they have here, for free, as well as seasonings to liven it up (not that popcorn needs anything else, but sometimes its nice, I guess). 
Bloody Marys, which they pretend to not mind making for me all night long. There is one bartender here who puts a delicious menagerie of pickled treats in my drink, which is always a bonus. 
Pear Cider, which is my second choice for when bartenders give me the "I don't want to make that drink" face. It happens.
Last on the list is the $1 ladies night discount, which just so happen to be on the weekends during peak drinking hours here. 

Right on!
author: Vanessa R.

description:
This is truly a neighborhood bar, if you go here expecting the Hilton & are not impressed, your either drunk already &/or are in the wrong hood.
Bar staff are very friendly & drinks are reasonably priced. 
I drink in the hood & this a a good place for a night cap on the way home after work.
Like any bar it has its own personality & you either like it or don't, I personally like it.
Its close to a few food joints I frequent also, so handy to watch a game & grab a bite at the same time. Milanos comes to mind, which reminds me I must review them also.
4 stars cuz its a Good local hangout, en-fa-sizing LOCAL!
author: Jennifer R.

description:
I stopped in randomly yesterday afternoon (on a  Sunday.)
The Bartender (Elaine) was awesome. 
I chatted with some of the regulars and had a few shots.
This is totally my kind of bar. Stiff drinks, nice bartenders and close to public transportation. 
Who doesn't love a drunken MUNI  ride??
author: Karlee D.

description:
Not for me or anyone we were with...

Here is why:

$25.50 for 4 beers with tip and 2 were flat..... Yuck....

The bathroom had urine all over the ground... Maybe the staff's fault, maybe not... Gross...

The seats are uncomfortable....

Lastly, the people in front of us who got some food were saying how awful it was...

The little bartender behind the bar was beyond annoying.... Sorry, but true.....

Too many other places to go....
author: Joe B.

description:
Popcorn with seasoning!!! Great beers on tap! Has a local vibe to it that made me feel like an out of towner as I'm not from the Sunset District. 

Chill place, a great place to go before heading out. I could also honestly see myself hanging out for a long time if left to my own devices....
author: Allegra F.

description: This would be a solid spot if the bartenders weren't incredible a-holes. The plug bottom owner cruises through and does nothing. Yes, I know I haven't been a drunk for 12 years...I just don't have the time to get here at 8am to put in "my time". Overall, a sub par spot. Head to Blackthorn.
author: Alex S.

description:
Definitely my new local and should be for any soccer loving, right minded local. 

Upon my first visit there to watch ENGLAND vs usa, i easily met some good people that matched my enthusiasm for the beautiful game. The staff are as friendly as the crowds it continuously draws in. 

The cost of drinks i don't know or care, since Mucky Duck sits on lively 9th Avenue (Golden Gate Park side) you can even order food from next door and bring it inside to eat. What else is left to say?!
author: ali n.

description: My first time at Mucky Duck on Halloween night and the place was our last stop of bar hopping. Perfect, they had Food!! We were starving and Milanos pizza across the street was closed! I don't know if they have this food spread every night or just because it was halloween. They had reminiscence of hot dogs and chili, spaghetti and pastries. My friend was chowing down on the last of the spaghetti and I was playing it safe having some pastry. Ok besides the free snacks lots of beer!!
author: Karen T.

description: Came here around 9 and stayed for about 1.5 hrs on a sat night. The place wasn't too packed and loud so i could actually have convos with my friends without having to lose my voice. Bartender got the beers out pretty quickly. Both beers were delicious. I tried 2 beers. One was tangerine flavored and was a better version of the blue moon. It tasted more fruity and refreshing. The 2nd beer was darker, more chocolaty and smokey, but equally good and fulfilling.
author: Liwei Y.

description:
As far as dive bars go, Mucky Duck is pretty standard. 

I stopped in to grab a quick pint and watch some of the NBA playoffs. The bartender and clientele were all friendly, and everyone there seemed to be a regular. The pool table was in use constantly, but aside from that, everything at MD was pretty low key. 

Like seemingly all of the dive bars in SF, this place is cash only, so come prepared. 

Also, there's free popcorn, which is always a treat.
author: Tom A.

description:
We came here to watch the Giant's game for the World Series. It's a narrow bar, but long, so a large amount of people can fit in there, just not always so comfortably.

The bartenders were all fairly nice, but I think it's because they all knew a girl that we came in with so we rode on her coatails. They do have popcorn there, but it's in the very back near the pool table and people were just huddled around it. The bar top is pretty expansive and even have hooks under the countertop for gals with large purses or jackets or whatever, so I thought that was a nice touch. The seats are rather uncomfortable and I feel the high tables were just a tad bit too large and too close to the seats at the bar top.

The bathroom was gross. It's all the way in the way in the back, it's a single toilet, the paper towel dispenser was one of the old school ones where you have to wind it up to get paper towels out... gross. The bathroom smelled too.
author: Susie H.

description:
A supposedly English bar that's all about sports.  Pool table and dart games are usually in effect -- and that's about it.  Shitty jukebox, popcorn and peanuts usually on the floor.  Sometimes you'll get snappy bartenders who don't enjoy witty women... and overall, it's a bit of a "men only" establishment.

Cheap drinks, and ok if in company of friendly macho boys.
author: Vicky B.

description:
Where do you go when you're with the guys, and it's a friday night? "Hit up the Duck Rash!" is what me and the boys yell before we start a night of partying.

I've been going to Mucky Duck for the pass 5+ years, matter fact the picture in my profile was taken at Mucky Duck. It's a great humble bar with very attentive, down to earth, friendly bartenders. 

If you're ever walking around 9th and Irving and feel a little thirsty. 
Stop by the Duck!
author: Tip S.

description:
Stumbled into Mucky Duck Sunday evening after we discovered the BF's backpack was stolen out of my car. That definitely meant it was time for a drink. Or two. Or three.

We sat at the edge of the bar and had ourselves a couple of ciders (yum!) while eyeing the popcorn machine in the corner. The bartender told us it was free so of course we helped ourselves!

Free popcorn = $0
Averagely priced drinks = $20
Alcohol therapy after getting robbed = priceless

For that, we will always hold Mucky Duck close to our hearts.
author: Peggy T.

description:
If you're not a crusty 40+ daytime drunk male, or have a strong aversion to such company this might not be your place.

Also if you are afraid of places that look like they might smell like pee, this might not be your place either.

Probably wouldn't recommend flying solo if you're young, female, and looking for anything other than a slightly socially depressing evening surrounded by men who may or may not own a toothbrush. However, if you're game for spending a night in a dive bar with marginally enjoyable, yet completely cliche jukebox classics and a decent beer selection, I do recommend dropping in with a few friends, getting sloppy with the local flavor, and trying to piece together how you got home the next day.
author: Steph-a-saurus, Grr. J.

description:
I always have a great time at this neighborhood pub.

So we walk in tonight after dinner at Dragonfly.  Bar is crowded, but not so packed that you can't move.

"So what is that beer like, 'Death & Taxes'?"  I ask the cute bartender.

"Dark and bitter" he says with a smile.

"Wow, kind of like me!"  I say.  "That sounds perfect.  And...well, I'm pretty sure I can count on it."

Bartender chuckles.  I'm sure he's heard that a million times, but he still makes me feel like I'm funny.

My friend orders a Harvey Wallbanger, and then spills it all over the bar.  No one gets mad and another one appears right away.  Our men-folk order beer and get locked into something on TV.  Mmmm, I like it, just like home but with slightly more alcohol.

We play darts.  Surprisingly, no one gets hurt.  

A group of Bag-piping Irishmen come in an play some great tunes, and the entire bar cheers. The almost-half of me that is Scottish feels the lure of the Highlands.  We buy raffle tickets.

I sit by the sign that says "No Slapping Zone". Can I get one of those for my house?

"Add It Up" comes on the Jukebox and our heads bounce as we sing along to every word.

It's one of those nights where everything is funny and as we walk out the door full and happy, and disappear into the dense fog, I think, "We should really go to that bar more often".
author: Liz S.

description:
I hesitate to give the MD three stars because I really did have fun here after the after party for B2B. However, it's very likely that my experience and enjoyment were based on my gross intoxication and spectacular partners in crime.

MD is a dark little dive bar with musty patrons, a decent jukebox, and plenty of room to dance (oh yes I did) with your sloppy drunk girlfriends, should you be so inclined. Btw- we were the only girls in the bar and the other patrons were the handsy, leering type (not that I can blame them- my friends are pretty hot) but they bought us drinks all night so I'm not complaining.

I wouldn't make a special trip over and it's not the kind of place I usually frequent, but it wasn't a bad place to end up after a long day of walking, drinking, and debauchery.
author: Autumn K.

description:
Cheers!

It's dangerous to live relatively close to a bar especially a sports bar.
I love to drink and my friends know it. I might be an alcoholic but at least I'm good at it. 

It's a bar! It's supposed to be dirty, sticky, and full of drunk people. It's not a library, it's not a beauty salon, it's a bar. You don't wanna come here dress up or you'll be laugh at. That is all.
author: Stanley K.

description: This is the home bar for my current APA 9-Ball league team. The bar finally grew on me and I love it when monday nghts roll around since that's when league night is. The pool table isn't perfect and has weird rolls where a sure straight-in shot might take a weird turn and not go in. It gives the table some character which is a love/hate relationship with me. Bartenders here are great, friendly, and I don't have to spend a lot of energy trying to get their attention. Red's one of the bartenders here and also on my 9-ball team. One time, he suggested I get a Moose Drool since I like brown ales and now it's the beer I usually get when I'm over here now. I think I spent a little bit too much money on the jukebox, but sometimes it just gets a little too library quiet in there. Plus I love shooting pool to some good tunes. Anything from 70s soul, to Jimi Hendrix, Slum Village, Red Hot Chili Peppers, The Clash, etc. Something for everyone there. Did I mention there's free food here? Sometimes it's sandwiches, otther times it's hot dogs or popcorn.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
I likey. premium vodka is only 5 bucks, not bad at all. my friend & I sat at the end of the bar and I was wondering, why are these dorks standing there yapping. turns out the dartboard is a foot from my head, not a good thing when beered-up boys start throwing sharp objects. but anyhow, we liked the bartender who was so fast and had the smile of a movie star. the bartendress, on the other hand, was the original harpy from hell. excuse me Satan, I think one of your daughters is missing, please retrieve her from this otherwise cool bar on 9th Ave.

ps -- don't expect to find pretty folks here except for me and my amiga. for a Saturday night, the joint was bumping w/ some aesthetically challenged patrons. the cute boys were at Yancy's and the wimpy fugly boys came here. shit. some chicks were rather weird and spastic, waving their arms around (who in the fuck knows) and shrieking. illicit substances, perhaps
author: Prima D.

description:
Long Bar. Pool Table. Dart Boart. Old Men. Young Hipsters. Students. Smoke. Booze.

The Dive Bar of Inner Sunset.  

Come one come all....and get trashed.
author: Jay H.

description: I think this is a Charger's Bar.  At least that's the impression I got when I saw the Charger's jersey hanging high inside. I've only been there once to watch the Charger's season opener. The vibe was def dive bar. Free popcorn. I remember bringing in some pizza from outside and they didnt care.I loved it, they reped the Chargers!
author: Grace P.

description:
It's surprisingly a local bar. Not like, local in that it's in the neighborhood. I mean that people who live in the neighborhood actually frequent the place. And they have regulars. 

The crowd is pretty low-key, except on weekends when it only gets slightly more hopping. But hey, I like that... and it's not so busy that you can't get your drink on. Good mix of people, and nice assortment of beer.
author: Clinton L.

description: This is a great neighborhood spot if you want a less crowded experience and has a great selection of beers. Its more low key and not as loud as Yancy's. They have a great jukebox and there is quite a bit of regulars. You can sit and watch a game and just relax its like a homey atmosphere but still being a sports bar.
author: Nadia N.

description:
My friend and I tried to forget our horrendous lunch with a drink and we stumbled upon the Mucky Duck. Truly we couldn't resist a place with a name that rhymes, so we entered.

The bartender was super nice. They had a crazy selection of beers on tap. They have Chimay which I have never seen on tap and rarely see bottles of. I was almost tempted, but I decided on Speakeasy White Lightning. I love white beer and this was a great pint. My friend had a regular Speakeasy pint. Speakeasy is a great local beer brand with a few different varieties. I would highly recommend getting a pint next time you're at a bar that serves it. 

This is your classic dive bar. Its really small and dark. It's definitely not somewhere you would want to go for an exotic night out. But it was great for a relaxing afternoon beer with good company.
author: Ashley R.

description:
I will officially be the first person to yelp this place: The Sucky Duck.

If you could take a shitty FM radio station, say something called Lips 109 or 88.7 The Beat, and somehow dump the boredom into a little room; then pack that room with Fashion Bug employees; then, for shits and giggles, fill it with smoke...you would have the Sucky Duck.
author: Rob D.

description:
I haven't been here since my famous alcohol tour of '03 (aka my 21st birthday), and coming back only this year seems kind of a shame. But none the less, I still love this place... ! It's super chill with a pool table in the back, and the bartender was nice enough to give me and my friend a free sample of beer when we were unsure of what to get. I also love that the bartender emphasized how he doesn't carry a lot of imports, but supports a lot of local brews and keeps those on tap. I thought that was pretty cool. And $2 Tecate sounds good if you're on a budget. 

All in all, it's a good place to hang out at when you're tired of all those hoopla bars that litter downtown. This is just a no nonsense neighborhood place and that's what makes it a good place to go. It's well lit, too! And it's also the first place I've been in that has a rug... at least I think it had a rug?
author: Caroline L.

description: I really like the previous post on Mucky Duck. It's an old-fashioned bar right on 9th by the intersection of 9th and Irving. It's a great bar to hang out at with a fun atmosphere that seems AUTHENTIC. It's not hip or new. It's not smart. It's a bar that will attract visitors in an open area, so it's not dark and musky. It attracts the young and sociable. It's the kind of bar you find in many American cities. The name gets it a total star.
author: Denise C.

description:
In terms of how much of a dive is The Mucky Duck... I'd say it's an "Armstand Back Double Somersault Tuck." (the coolest sounding dive I saw when googling :P) What does this mean? Basically any qualities that make a bar a dive bar can be found here. 

Smoking after 11pm (and trust me, you notice quick), pool in the back, beer, whiskey, old men staring at young women, etc. 

One of the grossest things... My guy friend walked into the bathroom and one of the older regulars hadn't locked the door and he saw him "flogging the dolphin." Needless to say I made sure to avoid anything this guy touched after that. 

Otherwise... the bar is fun, pretty decent amount of seating, and I don't know who said there weren't beer specials, but I all I saw were signs everywhere posting different beer specials. None on the night we went except for the "Ladies Discount" (see Jessica L.'s upcoming review for more details on this!). 

From what I remember...

Monday Night- Industry night (for those who work in restaurant/bar)
Wednesday Night- I think something like $2 Coronas??? 
uh... not sure about the rest... 

Also I liked that the bartenders didn't scoff at the fact that I drank a lot of water.
author: Ali R.

description:
Ya know as much as like to complain about bars that have been overrun with Marina yuppies, Mission hipsters, or European wankers, this place could actually use some of them. 

I'm by no means a snob (OK that's a lie), but this bar does seem to attract some fairly unsophisticated folk. Not thugs, just sort of uninteresting and a little pedestrian. You would sort of expect that in a dive-bar but unlike the dives in the TL where the regulars offer a fascinating window into the world of human dysfunction, the Duck's patrons just seem like people that are way too into sports, trucks, and jet skis. Nikki H. hit the nail on the head in her review where she said "It's the closest you can get to finding San Diego here in San Francisco". And that's not a ringing endorsement is it? 

In addition to the idiot friendly juke box (Sublime? Really? Is that the best you can do?) there seems to be some indication that the ownership supports our current idiot President and the occupation of Iraq. That's my interpretation and could be wrong but the place seemed friendly to that kind of jingoism and I'm not too keen on supporting it. 

That being said, I've had at least one fun night here and the staff seem to know what they are doing, particularly the tall red headed guy. They have a pool table and some fairly serious dart players.  Seems based on other reviews there are some drink specials to help out the broke people who probably have the most reason to drink so at least they are performing a public service. There's usually a boisterous crowd out in front, particularly during local and high profile sports matches and the energy seems pretty good. I think I'd still rather go to the Fireside Bar but if my choices are limited to the Mucky or Yancy's well then the lesser of two evils gets my vote. And that's Al Gore.
author: lazslo t.

description:
Oh, I love the Mucky Duck. It's best during off hours when it's not packed to the gills, and is a fun place for a few drinks and a game of pool. They have a smallish, but good selection of beers on tap. I always like the bartenders here who tend to be young and are always talkative and friendly. 

On certain nights they have great beer deals whether it's ladies night or cheap Tecate night. When I lived around here this was where I went to drink. They also have a pretty good jukebox.
author: Mike P.

description: 20+ beers on tap, one of which is Death and Taxes.  Neighborhood fav w/ cool folks and very chill.  Sometimes it's nice not to be "cheek-to-cheek" while you down your bev.
author: Zac M.

description:
Walking in here reminds me of accidentally running into the men's room when I'm drunk and really have to pee. Except that I'm sober and really need to drink beer.

The beer selection is decent, with plenty of good local brews on tap, and the bartenders have all been downright congenial every time. The company, while reminiscent of a hunting party breaking for the night, is excellent. There's sports on t.v., jukebox and pool in the back and plenty of great conversations to jump in on. It's a chill, low-pressure joint in which to unwind and get your drink on.

In some moods I prefer it to Yancy's and Fireside because it's so low-looww-key and friendly. Although there's about a 90% chance of being the only female in there, there's 0% chance of being bar-stalked by a creep.
author: J P.

description:
I love the Duck. Never had a bad time here. Mike the bartender is my favorite-incredibly nice guy who can really beat the shit out of a dude(which I witnessed 2 weeks ago) Ladies get a dollar off their drinks. They always play Giants games and the jukebox is pretty decent. Pool table in the back, dart board in the front. A couple tables line the wall which is absolutely plastered with sport memorbilia. Good place to go with your friends and just hang out. They treat their regulars VERY well. Noah the bouncer is hilarious and will protect you from the creepy older men that hit on you. Unless Noah is the one hitting on you-then you're on your own :) Hilarious to see girls walk in with min dresses and 5 inch pumps...its not that kind of bar. Come in with your jeans and chucks and settle in for a long night!

As a side note, no amount of money will get you to the Donkey show. Trust me, Ive tried.
author: Mary B.

description: This is a great little dive bar! I love just to go hang out there on a week night, and they're also fun for bigger events (I had a blast watching the Giants win there!) The bar tenders are all really nice, and make a good drink. Noah and Brett have been especially nice. I'm sure I will be there again soon : )
author: Jennifer F.

description:
I'd only been to the Mucky Duck once before... Where I was pretty much the only chick in the whole joint.  

Last night there were two other females (including the bartender) besides myself, which still didn't even out the sausage fest...  But it is one of THOSE kinds of bars.  

Anyhow... The Back Of The Bus Podcast is always on the look-out for another establishment that can rock a savage bloody mary and I thought I recalled hearing this place had a good one.  

SECOND BEST in SF (so far...)!!!  The only reason I'm not giving this place 4 stars is the fact that there's a slight vomit odor one picks up when walking through the door.  This bar has carpet (WHY would any bar EVER want to have CARPET?!!!) and who knows what drunk people have spilled/dropped on it over the years.  All bad.  

Otherwise, this little dive is pretty rad spot to chill if you find yourself in the Inner Sunset.
author: MoMo D.

description: OK bar except for the bartenders.  Apparently having seasonal allergies means you get your drink orders denied.  Bartender with the glasses was a complete bitch.
author: T M.

description: A pretty chill bar, had a pool table, dart board, popcorn machine and cheap beers. That pretty much sums up the bar.
author: Kate D.

description: It was a late afternoon visit.  Busy, but not crowded.  Friendly bartender.  Definitely a saloon/pub feel.  Chips for sale.  Jukebox.  Regulars.  They need a few more Irish whiskeys, though.  Jame and Bushmills was the limit.
author: Ken B.

description:
A dark gloomy bar with a juke box where no one will know your name... well some may know your name, but few will be sober enough to recite it. This is where I come to sulk in the corner and pine over that one that got away.

...or where I come to rage with a bunch of bikers. Pick your poison.
author: Taylor E.

description: I was at the Mucky Duck for the unfortunate loss of the 49ers in the playoffs.  The bar itself is kind of crappy in a run-down-but-not-in-a-cool-divebar kind of way.  The bar was obviously packed because of the game and I have to say that the staff did a really excellent job of handling the crowd considering that there were only two bartenders and two barbacks clearing glasses.  What really pissed me off though were the ridiculous drink prices.  I don't know if they were inflating the charges because they knew it would be busy because of the game or what, but I was with several people that were drinking.  Beers were $6 a pint and then they were charging $3 for cokes for our sober friend.  Excuse me but that is some BS and any low-end bar that thinks they can charge that much for a regular pint and something that should be complimentary will not be getting my business again.
author: Hallie K.

description:
The Mucky Duck used to be that *one spot* within every major nightlife scene where the not-so-young-and-beautiful could gather, imbibe, and converse amongst those of their own ilk. During the late 90's, it was the go-to spot in the Inner Sunset for all things shady.

Fast forward to 2006.  I've been here three times in the last year, and each time it's seemed that the old guard has moved along.  Yow...this place was just too young for me.  Every face I saw looked like it was within two years of legal drinking age.  Two girls in their early twenties to my right were clearly avoiding any kind of eye contact with me.  One lone youngster to my left had tattoos and a funky hairdo....he was about as engaging as a post-puberty kid while being lectured by his parents.

Decor is standard issue beer-advertising schlock, a smattering of garden-variety NFL stuff, and a tiny bit of fairly weak sports memorabilia.  Well placed TV's and LCDs make the place a decent spot to catch a game, but the music is surprisingly old-guard, static, and stale.  A single dart board occupies a freakish spot towards the entrance, while a pool table sits towards the rear.

The Mucky Duck always seemed to be the Inner Sunset's haven for misfits and outcasts of all ages.  As of late, little has changed, save my observation that the collection of misfits seems to have grown younger.  Maybe I've hit this place at bad times, but on the three recent occasions where I've darkened the door at the Duck, I've failed to strike up any sustained conversation with the patrons.  Twenty-somethings may have a different experience, but I found it cold, lacking character, and middle-aged hostile.  I gave it several tries....and I don't see much reason to return.
author: Mike W.

description:
This is a great spot to enjoy Giant games. There's usually a guy from next door restaurant that serve American comfort food that will bring you food if you order. A plate usually cost about 8 bucks. Mucky Duck offer drinks at very standard price around 5 bucks for a pint of good craft beer. They also offer free popcorn with like 3-4 seasonings.
If you're looking for a sports bar that has great atmosphere for a Giant's game, this is the place to be!
author: Mike S.

description:
Very solid local neighborhood bar establishment.

I live in the area, and I always want to do my drinking here, but my roommates usually end up dragging me (kicking and/or screaming) to Yancy's or Fireside down the street.  I still come in by myself for a beer or two from time to time.

There is a definite locals vibe I get when I walk through the door.  It's not so much a "Who the fuck are you?" as a "Who fucking cares who you are."  It's more ignoring than hostile, which is an important distinction.

I've never really seen it crazy inside, or packed with ladies for that matter, so I wouldn't go here to pick up chicks or entertain out of town friends.  Its one of those places where almost every guy at the bar is sporting a ball cap.  Go here alone or with a buddy, quiet enough place to talk or kill time with ESPN, but not enough going on for a date or a pack of drunks, 

I really like the bartender Mike.  He seems to be all over the place talking to regulars, playing pool, vetoing jukebox selections, but at the same time I still got some small talk from him and I never saw the bottom of my glass without a new one on the way.

Ok, concrete details:
Honest pours.
Cheap, but not dirt cheap.
Darts,  pool, TV's with sports.
Good (but not amazing) beer selection.
Very good jukebox.
author: Matt R.

description: Found this gem one of the first days I moved to San Francisco and it has never disappointed.  Great selection of beer.  Red, the bartender, is ridiculously badass.  I frequent this place quite often for the darts, free popcorn, and good times.  Definitely worth checking out if you are in the Sunset.
author: Vinh N.

description:
The Mucky Duck (a.k.a. the Yucky Duck) is the perfect dive bar. And I don't mean dive bar in the ironic hipster way. I mean a REAL dive bar. 

They have bras hanging from the ceiling, serve white lightning and pbr on tap, have a dart board and a pool table, and, get this, titty memory. yes they actually have a machine where you can play memory, but with boobs. 

That seals it for me. Despite the guy with the UFC shirt hogging the pool table, I just can't give this place any less.
author: Anders L.

description:
I've sat in here many an afternoon, depressed, weary, a broken man just shy of thirty. This place did little to break that sense of self-loathing. Can I blame them? No. That's the nature of the beast. They were prompt and attentive. 

I did go on a suicide trip down to Carmel a few years ago and sat in another Mucky Duck there. I decided it wasn't my time yet. Not here, I said to myself. Not now.
author: Roy M.

description:
Your classic dive bar that you could find just about anywhere in California, or really America for that matter. It doesn't try to be hipster, lounge-y, Irish, Belgian, niche, classy, brassy, or kitschy. There's plenty of sports on TV, Bud signs, a shit-ton of beers on tap, and bartenders that know how to pour a shot. 

The best part about it is that it's right here in belly button of San Francisco, the Inner Sunset.
author: Brandon B.

description:
Ladies' night is Saturday (read: $4.50 cazadores shots) and the crowd is unpretentious and mostly fun here, with mixed ages tending to be from late 20's to mid-40's. 

Overall, the combination of a pool table, darts, and reasonably priced booze makes this one of my preferred neighborhood bars.
author: Caroline C.

description:
I was doing some searching for other places to try a bloody mary in SF and came across one recommendation for the Mucky Duck.   Odd enough I've spend a ton of time in the inner sunset and have never tried this place - so what a perfect opportunity.

A couple friends of mine end up going on a Sunday early evening, so the place is pretty packed with football fans.  Right off the bat, it seems like the crowd was very family-like, but to outsider I didn't get a very warm welcoming feeling.  Owell - I was here to try the bloody mary. 

****bloody mary review*****

When we ordered the drinks, the bar tender did ask how spicy we like them, which is always a good call in my book.  The ingredients used were the traditional flavor and to my un-happiness they did use Tabasco, which IMO is the worst hot sauce to use in a bloody mary.  It was also served in a pretty small glass (anything smaller than a pint-glass is small in my book).  All-in-all the taste was fair, but nothing I would ever go back for. Although it came with a pickled green bean, this just didn't make up for the taste. Maybe I just had a bad bar tender make mine, but at this point I can't agree with the recommendation I read.   

Cheers!

Read some of my other Bloody Mary reviews at:
http://www.yelp.com/list_details?list_id=YHu-iA23Xj2c1bVa7JROhA
author: Josh M.

description: I was here a few weeks ago on  a Friday afternoon with a girlie friend for some gossip and catching up. We got there around 4 and it was still quiet with some regulars at the bar. By 6 pm, the bar was crowded with a more diverse crowd and some UCSF students/faculty. I liked the popcorn and the accessibility to the Bank of America (being cash only.) Our bartender, Casey, was a really cool girl that served us efficiently while laughing at our jokes. I truly appreciate a down to earth, no fuss, easy-going bartender during the afternoon when it is still a bit quiet and our conversations can easily be heard. She made incredible lemon drops! Overall, would go there again and again (BUT don't bother with the Mai Tai's, I've had better.)
author: Riley M.

description:
I love the Mucky Duck.  Good selection of beer, bartenders who can make good recommendations, and a more or less amiable crowd.

The only downside is that I'm not the only fan of the Mucky Duck, so it can be a bit too crowded to really enjoy your beer.  Most times I've been there, though, I am able to get a seat by the front window where I can relax and chat with friends.

Not sure what nightly deals they have, so I guess I need to go more often.
author: Zach P.

description: This bar is like the staging area for a complete rage-fest that will come later (at another bar). It's a total dive, and you might even hear some sublime. It's the closest you can get to finding san diego here in san francisco.
author: Nikki M.

description:
5 stars.  Why?  $1 ladies' discount.  Oh yeah.

And it's just an all-around awesome low-key bar.  Good beers...we got the Speakeasy White Lightning.  

Not a hipster in sight.  Okay, maybe one.
author: Gina K.

description:
I wish inner sunset had more nicer bars. I have been here a few times because my husband likes it for some reason. Its good for people over 40 years old. It sucks for the rest of us. The drinks are not that great. I would just recommend having a beer and maybe playing some pool. The bartenders are not that friendly either which kind of kills it.

I gave it 2 stars because my hubby likes it.
author: Rejina S.

description: I love this bar!! The bartenders are so fast and friendly! It has a great jukebox, free popcorn and several TVs to watch sports. It has become one of my favorite spots to frequent. Thank you Mucky Duck!!
author: Terry K.

description:
best bar in the sunset
hands down
don't come here for the design or intellect
come here to drink - have a great time, and meet the locals
author: Pug P.

description:
I like it at the Mucky Duck. They have good drink specials and the prices are all around pretty low. They also seem to have popcorn every now and then. 

Also, the bartender let me try a taste of Budweiser's American Ale before buying a pint. Thank god for that, because American Ale is some really nasty shit.

Unfortunately, they don't take credit cards so they lose a star for that. Of all the businesses that should take credit cards, bars are at the top of the list. It's a real pain in the ass to practice sound cash flow management when you're trying to get your drink on.
author: Antony M.

description: Met a couple friends here and loved it !    Very nice staff.   Mellow bar.   There is jukebox, so you can pick your own music.   It was fun to have techno in an Irish Pub .     ;)
author: Foodie B.

description:
My first experience with jager...but I won't count that against this place.

Darts, pool table, cheap-ish drinks - everything a dive bar should be.
author: kiki d.

description:
Ahh its Sunday, and theres a Giants game on. I am at Mucky Duck chillin in the dark. 

Especially nice moment when I went to the ladies room and as I passed the drunk dudes playiong pool, they said "here comes tits" 

nice.
author: Amanda L.

description:
"The Mucky Duck - Perfect Place to Wash Out Dinner at Cafe Gratitude"
I've read reviews about the SupperClub - an impossible place to get a drink - MD is drinker heaven - I had 2 beers and a Sprite in 5 minutes and under 10 bucks!  Very neighborhood bar - where everyone knew everyone - a bit intimidating at first - although everyone was very nice to us newbies.  There's at least one person who merits line-cutting at the pisser - let him - although he could do his business with more expediency.  Also of note - pool shark haven - this guy needs to go to Vegas  and make some real money.  Definitely going back next time I eat at CG - hmmm - that doesn't seem too likely. Oh well - nice bar.
author: Mario P.

description:
I love the Mucky!

And I have just learned so much about it after reading these reviews and going on their website.  I can't believe they have a website and it's really good!  And they have free hot links with NFL?  Jesus.

I love the Mucky b/c everyone is as cool as shit in there.  And if you want the BEST bloody mary, go here.  Jason, the owner, makes it the best but everyone else- Carrie especially- also does it up super nice.

Five stars seem excessive?  Not for me.  It's everything I want in a bar.  It's perfect.
author: Staci M.

description: Cool bartenders + bouncer, pretty good seating, strong drinks, average bar prices (Sapphire tonic, $6+tip). Popcorn machine is definitely a plus! I also don't know how many times I've ducked in here to take a piss while waiting for the N-Judah.
author: J H.

description:
Horrible.  A sa long time customer of this place, I have seen the changes...all for the bad.

Football on sunday is the main attraction.  The female bartender is the biggest money hungry jerk.  I don't drink on sundays, so I try and stick with juice or water.  Of course they charge you $3 for it, and no free refills.

Then, another customer drinking a beer may request your TV changed, she does it saying, "I get more tips from alcohol drinkers".  Whata ^@*#@!

Thank goodness Yancy's has football now too...this place is no longer a local place, but a place for frat boys.
author: Sir Paul L.

description: a gem of a bar. Definitely a locals only place! Haters can go over to T.G.I. Fridays!
author: S B.

description:
The name says it all.  Wouldn't exactly call it a dive, it has its share of drunks who hang there on a regular basis.  And hanging at the mucky on a slow night with a bunch of raging alcoholics doesn't make for a good night.  Not a good place to meet girls, even when busy.   The jukebox for the most part blows, but does have a few good tunes.

Lots of good beer on tap.  Good specials, like the $2 tecate on tues/thurs, or the 2fer micros on sunday. 

Bartenders are good and friendly.
author: cheddar b.

description:
I love this place!
Great selection of beers and friendly bartenders!
A++++
author: Margie C.

description: Good beer great people(a little wacky),but the heating does not need to be on full all the time its like a damn sauna,and for someone who plays league darts and has to play at this place which idiot decided to put the board by the door even the pubs own players do not like having to play there,a rethink may be required.
author: John R.

description:
When I first moved to the inner sunset almost 3 years ago I originally walked by this place and said "I'm never going in there!!!" it was dank and small and always seemed to have groups of people who I'd never associate with in my life hanging out in front.  However, that all changed when I began working just a stones throw away from this place. With a limited selection of bars in the area, I discovered this was the place that sold the cheapest drinks and had the best bartenders.  
  Now I'm not going to make this my end-all and be-all bar till the end of my days, but I've spent many a drunken evening in this place laughing my ass off, with the two Friday night bartenders Mike, and & Brent (the two best ones in my opinion), and some friends.  
 Also this place has such an eclectic bunch of characters who frequent it ranging from the mild mannered who just want to enjoy their drink with friends in peace to those boisterous bunch (you'll know them when you see them) you want to drag out my the hair and deposit ungracefully in the gutter.  Even so I've never had a bad night here and am happy to consider it one of my many watering holes around the city.
author: Nathan C.

description: Cheap cocktails and no snooty JCrewsters. I mean how much do you need to pay for shots of whiskey and bud light?
author: Lee S.

description: It's within crawling distance to my new home which gets a star right there.  The bartender was great, good beers on tap, decent jukebox (reminds me of my senior year in high school which is kinda fun) and the trivia machine lends to hours of entertainment.  My only question, why don't any bars ithis city have foosball???
author: Rachel C.

description: I liked their beer selection, not too big but they have some decent stuff, like Speakeasy! They only take cash which is a HUGE drawback for me, it's so inconvenient! Maybe if they took cards, I'd come here more often and spend more (hint, hint)
author: Tatyana K.

description: Fun place to be when you've already had a few and ya just wanna hang out with some great people and get even more loaded....If you can get pool table time you might even draw a little crowd to watch you play really badly. Your guy will taunt you and make ya look like a jack ass and some random guy at the end of the bar will buy both of you a round for non apparent reason.....HELL YES!!! Thank you random stranger by the way....I owe ya one.
author: Shaunna K.

description: I love to play pool and darts here.  The jutebox is decent, and the bartenders are nice.  But charging $3.50 for a can of PBR cost them not one, but 2 stars, cause I got robbed!
