author: Starla D.

description: This is my good friend Karen's neighborhood bar, and boy does she love it.  She loves it so much that she'd give it five stars.  And possibly move in.  That's because she knows the bartender (Dusty), and I have a feeling that she doesn't really pay for drinks there anymore.  The Mucky is fun, and a true neighborhood bar, and you can get pizza from across the street (at least, I THINK it's across the street, but honesty compels me to admit that when we order pizza, it's a bit late in the evening, and someone might be a few sheets to the wind).  As for me, I probably wouldn't make this a destination (because when I'm in a destination mood, I have the Mission, or sometimes I like fancy and swanky (I'm more frivolous than Karen)), but  the Mucky's very fun when I'm with Karen.
author: Laurel B.

description: Good prices, good for sporting events and cheap happy hour! Plus $2 tecate on Tuesdays and I think Thursdays too.
author: Megan L.

description: Lots of TVs. Free Popcorn. They serve booze. It gets the job done, but it wouldn't impress your new girlfriend.
author: Haz O.

description: I like this place - maybe even for all the wrong reasons. I have not been here a lot, but every time I have been here I have noticed that there were always multiple patrons missing one or more of their front teeth. That's kind of a strange coincidence don't you think? I do think this place has it's regulars, and I have definitely gotten the "Who the fuck are these people?"  vibe here before from some folks, but ultimately it is just a neighborhood bar where fights may almost breakout, but rarely do.
author: J F.

description: Happened upon this place after our original destination was closed.  Not too much to say - it seems to be an Irish-pub-themed place but there is more Raiders and 49ers stuff hanging than Irish stuff.  The bartender was nice and friendly.  The bar was crowded but we got seats fine.  Nothing wrong with this place, I wouldn't mind coming back but it won't ever be in my top 10.
author: Jeanie C.

description: Apparently this spot is owned by U of O alums so it's the perfect spot to get your drink on if you're a Duck or just a Duck "hunter". Reminiscent of nickel beer night at your favorite undergrad bar in your favorite rural college town.
author: Mingus R.

description: Small, friendly, free popcorn, clean bathrooms, good nightly specials (shot of Jim and a beer for $5, $2 Tecate cans), few people, nice bartender, run-of-the-mill facility.  The end.
author: Eric S.

description:
gotta love the mucky duck for the following reasons (in no particular order):
1) pool table and darts. beware of the darts.
2) popcorn with lots of different seasonings. msg-laced, i'm sure but still! mmm, seasoning.
3) a jaeger kegerator.
4) sports, sports, and more sports on HDTV. great place for an irish coffee and the world cup before you hop on the n-judah, or many shots of jack and a raiders game.
5) mostly friendly bartenders, esp Big Mike on the weekend nites
6) good mix of neighborhood regulars and younger folks (maybe college kids?! hard to say but they're younger than me).
7) it doesn't smell like vomit like the other neighborhood bar, yancys. love their plants, hate their puke.
author: Veronica Y.

description: Been here a couple times, lots of locals, nice bartenders, prices are pretty good too! It's a great little dive bar, lots of seating and also a pool tale and games in the back.  Perfect for a little happy hour before you head home after work =)
author: Lulu C.

description: Even if it was post-Bay to Breakers and starting to fill up with a-holes, this place is still pretty cool. Great HDTvs for sports, a super nice bartender and a better than average beer selection.
author: Andrew L.

description: It's a lovely bar.  A neighborhood local sort of place.  You can come in for a drink or two and wind up staying all evening and buying pizza to share with the guys at the next table.  Drop pretension - drink and relax, it's homey and always have the Giants on in season, the people are Giants fans.  I should have started with that.
author: .Hazel T.

description:
ah - THE DUCK! I have fond memories of this place - i was a film student at SFSU and my classmates and i would rush into this place after a 9 hour grueling day of documentaries and discussing how Pootie Tang fits into post modernism - never mind that we were already buzzing from whatever cheap beer was featured an hour ago at the pub on campus! You weren't allowed to smoke until 11 PM but with enough begging to the right bartender you may get to start puffing at 10:50! Jonathan was the best "pretend" bartender ever - I miss that guy! He would always give me money to play music on the jukebox - a great jukebox at that! My playlist would begin with Van Halen's Running w/the Devil, followed w/Darling Nikki and the Violent Femme's Gone Daddy Gone!
The place has a pool table, dart boards and now free popcorn and the best thing? The ladies room was always clean -then again it's usually a sausage party everytime I've been there! I've been meaning to come back to the Duck but I guess I'm holding onto my fond memories of this place -yeah fond memories from like 2 years ago!
author: Alexis D.

description: Typical dive bar, cash only (ATM next to the bar), and a good selection of beers.  I've been here twice and both times the bartenders were super nice.  Today we went during the day, so it wasn't packed at all yet it also wasn't empty.  Mila, the bartender was nice and made sure we never had an empty glass.  I definitely would come back for drinks though there isn't anything in here that sets it apart from other dive bars.
author: Denise B.

description:
decent place to hangout while waiting for the muni to come... had quick drink and couple of rounds of darts...

big ups to bouncer who didn't believe my birth date on my license=o)
author: Jana A.

description: Good selection of beers, both on tap and in bottles. The bar's pretty small, with good clientele. They allow indoor smoking here, which is either a big plus or a big, big minus.
author: Amy Z.

description:
the bartender was friendly and helpful. we didnt have any cash on hand but he let us have the beers anyhow, knowing that we'd hit up the ATM and pay him afterwards. so thumbs up for that. 

thumbs down for smoking in the bar, if only because my clothes smell like it afterwards and thats lame. but i guess smokers need somewhere to drink and smoke without going outside in the brutally cold san francisco spring.
author: Dan M.

description: I love the mucky duck.  The bartenders are great, the locals are not creepy and the prices are perfect.  Doesn't hurt that it is so close to home and the N line runs right in front of it.  If you're in the area and want a great dive bar, check it out - I doubt you will be disappointed.
author: Meredith N.

description: If you feel like some casual drinking but have a need to get out of the house, the Mucky Duck is a good place to go.  This is definitely a neighborhood bar with some character.  The bartender is friendly and gives you a beer sample if you can't figure out what to get.  There are hooks at the bar (plus for the ladies) and the prices are reasonable - just make sure you bring cash.  A great place to unwind or get the party started.  I'd come here more often, but the smoke that gets in this place kills my eyes.
author: Ixchel F.

description: I only went here once, but the regulars are nice, they chat you up cause they don't recognize you. The bartender was attentive, but I think it's because my date was throwing twenties at him. At least they have Patron.
author: Monica R.

description: Best bar in the Sunset. All the bartenders are kick ass. Ton of locals. Killer Bloody Marys. Pool and darts. Check it out and look for Red. He's highly skilled in the ways of the bartender and handsome too!
author: nic c.

description: This place is awesome!  Free Popcorn, cool bartender who looks like he should be the bass player in an 80's rock band. It's just the right amount of grungy, blue collar, and super cool.
author: Julien E.

description:
I love the Duck! Everyone is so friendly and the bartenders are great. They really want you to have a good time. It is more like a cheers place where everyone wants to hang out, listen to music, play pool, throw darts and drink for cheap. 

If you are looking for a good place to hang out with your friends and get a specialty beer this is your place!
author: Olivia S.

description: If I had single girlfriends who wanted to go to a bar for a quick and easy hook up, I'd send them here. Guy to girl ratio is probably 3:1 and the men who come here seem ready to go home with just about anyone. The bartenders are friendly and don't treat you different because you are a non-regular. Drinks are pretty cheap (I got a glass of Johnny Walker green label for $5!) and there is never a long line for the pool table. Good solid neighborhood bar.
author: Rebecca H.

description: This bar to me was pretty depressing... maybe because it wasn't my crowd, but i'm still giving it 3 stars, because they have a lot of TVs, darts, pool table, and good beer on tap.
author: Brian P.

description: This is a kick ass bar, lots of good people and the beer is always cold, doorman greeted us kindly and the bartenders made us feel at home.  So if your NOT looking to have a good time I would suggest going somewhere else.  Tuesdays and thursdays they have tecate specials.  When I'm in there I feel like i'm at a really cool party with a great mix of people, very few douchebags in there it seemed the door guy who I might add was quite the strapping fellow booted them all out to keep up the positive vibe.  Thanks mucky duck well be back.
author: Kali d.

description:
Let's see....2 dollar tecate on Tuesdays, great crowd during basketball season, free popcorn that everyone sticks their nasty hands into, and no laughing at my shitty pool playing skills.

What's there not to like?
author: Pinkyton C.

description: Pretty much my favorite weeknight bar.  This assessment is fueled largely by the fact that its four blocks from my house and the bartender knows my name.  Some decent TV's for sports watching, a kinda bumpy but adequate pool table, friendly barstaff, $2 Tecates on Tues and Thurs, can't go wrong really.  It gets a good crowd most every night, often the same people most every night, which is kinda fun when you can walk into a bar by yourself and say hi to several others around.  Its not a great weekend destination bar, unless you are into dive bars with not that many girls in them, but it is cheap and friendly.  And seemingly all the bartenders are named Mike, which makes things easy.
author: Jake S.

description: Very good price on drinks- 1 shot Captain Morgan+ 1 shot Jager+ 1 pint Wyder's cider= $14, not bad AND they have complimentary (i think) popcorn popped from a real popcorn popper, not microwave popped- a major plus.  I didn't stay very long, but it was a perfect place to go after jumping off a bus, having a quick drink to warm up and then moving on to larger more bustling atmospheres.  I can definitely see how it would be a good bar just to sit and chill if you were in a less sociable mood.  It's on the smaller side, shot-gun style where the bar runs the length of the room and creates kind of a walk way straight to the back (bathroom for ladies only??? the sign says guys will get kicked out, I didn't get it and a pool table.)
author: tamera t.

description: I always have fun here! cheap beer, entertaining bartenders and a pool table that you will never be able to play on, regulars tend to hover around it like the holy grail but whatever I suck anyway.
author: courtney b.

description: I used to like this bar, but the big, tall guy with a shaved head is the biggest jerk behind a bar in the city.
author: mary g.

description: So... They are open at 7am for the World Cup, and people were stopping in on their way to work for a quick view at the scores, a cup of coffee, a beer etc.  So my friend sits down and orders a coffee.  The bartender charges him $4 for his coffee, and then tells him if he does not like it he can "Fuck Off!"  He garbles "It's the world cup!  With world cup prices!"  And then goes into some asenine rant about freeloaders, even after recieving his $4.  He was trying to kick him out! After paying $4 for some burnt ass coffee from a bartender with a coke hangover and bad breath, he should at least be able to watch the game.  That place sucks!  Don't bother.
author: Erinn B.

description:
Finally, a dive bar up in my part of town. The collection of old bearded men who sit up front next to the dart board makes me happy inside. Beards in all shapes and sizes. Ah, that's the life. Oh and the beer isn't bad although heavily priced. Who knew they served Death and Taxes? Not me! And yes, it does smell like smoke in there but not as badly as those in the TL, considering the air is fresher up here in the Sunset given the extreme lack of crack heads floating around. And right on the N line or give or take a mile's ride back to the home front on my bike. Out of the way for most of my friends least they are crashing the night uptown but for the most part it's a selected bar in our circle. The bartenders are completely up front as well. My friend ordered a Newcastle and when he filled the glass he noticed it wasn't coming right out of the tap, asked her to taste it to see if it was flat (it was) and then gave her another drink to taste test. Which I promptly finished when she ordered one, mmm, dark rich beer. Heavenly. 

I think the Irish in me is sinking in. AHH.
author: Lydia H.

description: This place is cool if you don't mind leaving smelling like an ashtray.
author: Jennifer S.

description: I love coming here after work for a drink. The people are really friendly and very interesting.  I always have a great time and leave drunk. You should definitely check this place out.  Oh yeah, and ask for a Bloody Mary. You can't find a better one in the city!
author: Ambar M.

description:
I'll have to disagree with several of the reviews here.  The Mucky Duck is not a dive in the traditional sense of the word.  "Pub" describes the Mucky Duck much better, although it lacks any food service.

The Mucky Duck boasts an excellent beer selection, a fully stocked bar with many top shelf options.  The crowd is a combination of locals and students from UCSF.  Overall it is a relaxed and friendly atmosphere.  Prices are very reasonable; then again if you drink in the Sunset expect to pay about a dollar less for anything you order.

The Mucky Duck has a pool table, with a lot of play, so expect to wait a while if you want in.  The jukebox has a good selection of tunes.  Otherwise, there isn't much to figure out; just step in, order a pint, and enjoy one of the more laid-back bars in the Inner Sunset.
author: John B.

description: the mucky duck is a cash only dive that ignores its paying cutomers and treats regulars like gods.  a regular = alcoholic/bumb/dirtball.  i'd rather not be a regular at the mucky duck and i'll keep my cash too.
author: T D.

description: This is a good, basic bar type bar.  I went there on a tuesday night, just because we were in the area and wanted a bar and that's what was there.  A sports bar, with pictures of sports teams all over the walls, sports shows on the tv (and one weird show that was just people surfing over and over, like you're in a hollister store).  There is a pool table and a darts board.  Yes, there were people smoking as others have noted, but i thought that was just because even though there's supposed to be a law against it, people seem to do that a lot in places here in ca.  The jukebox was playing OLD music.  Some of the newer old music was from around 2000.  Some of the older old music was frank sinatra or other music from the 50s.  Then you have stuff in the middle too.  Weird.  It was pretty empty, but it was tuesday night so what could you expect.  My drink seemed ok, not sure how much it cost.  Overall, average bar.
author: Merredith L.

description: for some reason when i first visited the mucky duck, i i thought i'd be more refined than i really am and drink wine at a bar. after the first few sips,  i started feeling like a tool, so i drank the overfilled glass of syrah and ordered a pale ale. and thus began my co-dependent relationship with the mucky duck. they got my money, and they supplied me with the means to temporarily forget about my problems--i'm a happy drunk. win-win! yay!
author: Michael R.

description: Keep in mind it's a Thursday afternoon.  We walk in, and the smell of urine is so overwhelming, that I need to walk out, and I'm a nurse.  I'm used to the smell of urine.  My friends stayed inside and some even sat down at a table.  We did not stay  When I was inside for those 5 seconds, I saw interesting folks composed of older unrefined gentlemen with missing teeth, one hunched over a walker.  They looked like they were dying, but damn it, they were gonna die with a beer in hand and smelling of urine, and they'd die happy.  We did not stay.  It was gross.
author: Christine H.

description: from what i remeber this place was a good time. don't judge me. good prices and pool table . i like
author: kiki b.

description: mucky duck is okay for barhopping around (if you're in the neighborhood) and hanging out for no more than an hour or so but that's about it.. too much of a dude's spot for me, now on the other hand if i'm lit out of my mind, i might stay a bit longer
author: Syonora A.

description: Great place to go on Sundays to watch the NFL.  Always find other transplants there watching their "home team".  Great, friendly atmosphere and GOOD beer on tap.  Nice place to strike up a conversation with the random next to you.  Dart Boards a plus!
author: Lyndsey M.

description: my best friends girl lives right across the street and we always end up there on sunday mornings for great bloody marys. nfl ticket is there so go and catch your favorite game, or talk to the super nice (and cute) sunday bartender!
author: Brendan M.
